links.title: Tesla Drivers Are Paying Big Bucks to Test Flawed Self-Driving Software
links.description: Owners of newer Tesla models are driving cars with imperfect code, risking accidents. On a recent Saturday evening in South Carolina, Ward Mundy had his hands firmly on the steering wheel of his Tesla Model S when his wife let out a shout. The car was zig-zagging wildly across the road.

links.title: The Tesla Model 3 Goes To Production In July And Prototypes Aren't Completed Yet
links.description: Elon Musk says the new Tesla Model 3 sedan design was pencils-down and completed as of last summer. But documents filed by the automaker this week with the Securities and Exchange Commission sure make it seem like the sedan's design is still in flux, and industry sources say the timeline to move the Model 3 to production by this July is a stretch, given Tesla doesn't even have a beta prototype completed yet.

messages.body: $TSLA Damn Tesla just keeps falling further & further behind as the competition heats. EV trucks on the street SOON. http://gas2.org/2017/03/04/workhorse-1000-orders-plug-hybrid-electric-pickup-truck/

links.title: Workhorse Has 1,000 Orders For Plug-in Hybrid Electric Pickup Truck - Gas 2
links.description: Workhorse says it has letters of intent for 1,000 of its all new four wheel drive hybrid electric pickup truck from fleet operators. The W-15 will be revealed officially on May 2. It says it can produce 60,000 vehicles a year at its Ohio factory

links.title: Making Way For The Space Tycoons
links.description: Until recently, missions to put humans into space were government-owned programs, funded by public coffers and the tax dollars of citizens. However, the recent proposal from Elon Musk for colonizing Mars highlights the role of the private sector and tycoon visionaries in the future of space.
